title: Key Derivation without Entropy Waste.
abstract: We revisit the classical problem of converting an imperfect source of randomness into a usable cryptographic key. Assume that we have some cryptographic application P that expects a uniformly random m-bit key R and ensures that the best attack (in some complexity class) against P(R) has success probability at most δ. Our goal is to design a key-derivation function (KDF) h that converts any random source X of min-entropy k into a sufficiently “good” key h(X), guaranteeing that P(h(X)) has comparable security δ′ which is ‘close’ to δ.
departments: Institute of Science and Technology Austria
